item.title: The House races to end shutdown. And, Trump wants to close Kennedy Center for 2 years
item.description: Lawmakers are racing to end a partial government shutdown after Congress missed its funding deadline on Friday. And, Trump wants to close the Kennedy Center for two years for renovations.

item.title: Hemp and marijuana are the same species. So why all the different laws?
item.description: Farmers in the U.S. have grown cannabis since the 1600s — but policymakers are still figuring out how to regulate two famous types of Cannabis sativa. A historian calls the plant "incredibly cryptic."

item.title: After being hit by a car, she was saved by a lavender bunny
item.description: Eight years ago, Joann Moschella was injured after her bicycle was hit by a car. That's when her unsung hero appeared, dressed in a furry lavender bunny suit.

item.title: With an ACA fix uncertain in the Senate, Republicans replay old health care fights
item.description: Things are looking bleak for a fix in Congress for ACA premiums that doubled, on average, this month. And Republicans are making arguments against the law that haven't worked in years past.

item.title: Refugees relive the trauma they fled as ICE targets them in Minnesota
item.description: The Trump administration says it's reviewing thousands of cases to look for potential fraud. A judge ordered a temporary pause, saying refugees cannot be arrested "without warrants or cause."

item.title: Too old to compete? This 87-year-old triathlete has tips for staying in the game
item.description: Despite issues with her heart, this octogenarian still competes in triathlons. She's proof that preventive medicine paired with smart lifestyle choices help seniors stay active longer.

item.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt slated to reopen
item.description: Israel says it has allowed Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt to reopen, a key step in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire agreement. No one has crossed yet.

item.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopens for limited traffic
item.description: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step as the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead, according to Egyptian and Israeli security officials.

item.title: Punxsutawney Phil is said to have seen his shadow, forecasting 6 more weeks of wintry weather
item.description: When Phil is said to have seen his shadow upon emergence from a tree stump in rural Pennsylvania, that's considered a forecast for six more weeks of winter. If he doesn't see his shadow, an early spring is said to be on the way.
